Elle aimerai dans le futur ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en: Chantal is a 48-year old woman, a widow and the mother of six children ranging from 26 to 11 years of age. Five of her children are still in school. She and her children live off the revenues brought in by selling fresh food (manioc [cassava],  macabo [a type of starchy tuber] ) and dry groceries (beans), according to the season. She has been doing at the local market for two years. Her business is going extremely well, with the only problem being her limited capital, which forces her to purchase her wares in small quantities before retailing them. This does not leave much left for her family. She would like to buy wholesale (bags of manioc and macabo) in order to increase her profit margin and be able to save for her children’s education as well as to provide for their other needs. In the future, she would like to open a store.

loans.use: to buy bags of macabo tubers and manioc wholesale.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en:
Wedad is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to three sons. Her husband is a municipality employee and her elder son is a worker; both are getting low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's needs.

Wedad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture, such as: living room furniture and bedroom furniture in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking out this loan will offer to Wedad and her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

Wedad is photographed with her elder son Abdulaziz in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 28 years old, married and lives with her mother and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breakfast food (porridge, fried noodles and Khmer noodles) for more than six years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Saron is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Nak is 30 years old. She is married, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, and is blessed with one child. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business buying charcoal to resell. He earns about $8 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Nak is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more charcoal to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family.

 In the future, she would like to run an additional business in order to generate more income to support the family and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Luz Omaira

texts.es:
Luz desde pequeña ayudaba a su madre en la cocina y le gustaba mucho hacer las diferentes recetas que su madre le enseñaba a preparar; siempre se inclinó por este tipo de trabajo y cuando tuvo la necesidad de generar unos ingresos para su hogar esta fue la primera alternativa. Luz es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 hijos y con su negocio de comidas rápidas ha logrado generar los ingresos suficientes para brindarles una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para que puedan acceder a una educación de mejor calidad. Cuando el padre de sus hijos la abandonó y quedó a cargo de todos los deberes de su hogar, Luz y sus hijos sufrieron grandes dificultades económicas, pero gracias a su esfuerzo en su negocio ha logrado ir superando las dificultades y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calida de vida. En su negocio tiene muy buenas ventas motivadas principalmente por la buena calidad de sus comidas, pero debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital no ha podido seguir haciéndolo crecer y mejorar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Es por esto que Luz busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de las comidas rápidas y así alcanzar a responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes.

Así su negocio tendrá la oportunidad de seguir creciendo y brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es tener algún día un local donde pueda ofrecer el servicio de cafetería, restaurante y comidas rápidas y poder generar empleo para las personas con tantas dificultades como ella.
texts.en:
Luz, from a young age, helped her mother in the kitchen and very much liked making the different recipes that her mother taught her to prepare.  She always felt inclined towards this type of work and when she needed to generate income for her household this was her first choice.  Luz is a single mother, head of a family of two children and with her fast food business she has managed to generate the sufficient income to provide for them a good quality of life and better economic opportunities so that they can gain access to a better quality of education.  When the father of her children abandoned her and she was left in charge of all the household duties, Luz and her children suffered great economic difficulties but thanks to her efforts in her business she has been able to overcome the difficulties and provide her children with a better quality of life.  

In her business she has very good sales motivated principally by the good quality of her food but due to the fact that she does not have a great deal of capital she has not been able to continue making her business grow and improving the products that she offers her customers.  It is for this reason that Luz seeks a loan, in order to buy supplies for fast food preparation and thus to be able to respond to all of the orders of her customers.

In this way her business will have the opportunity to continue growing and providing good care to her customers.  Her biggest dream is to have someday a premises where she can offer a cafeteria, restaurant and fast food service and to be able to generate employment for people with as many difficulties as she had.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of fast food and thus to be able to respond to all the orders of her customers.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a woman with patience and dedication to her occupation. She is 53 years old and is married with six hard-working children. She is engaged in a piggery business, where she gets funds for their daily needs. She earned 5,000 pesos from the previous pig she disposed of. With the intent of improving her usual income, Leticia is asking for a loan of 6,000 pesos (PHP) to buy feed, medicine and vitamins. She hopes that she can create higher income from the loan to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha lives in Sta. Teresita and offers pedicure and manicure services. She is 33 years old, married and has six children. She has been patiently working in her chosen field for ten years and she knows that it is not easy to look for money. Despite that, she pursues her work for the progress of her family. 


Now, she is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy nippers, nail polish, nail brushes, cotton and pushers. These materials are necessary in her occupation because without them, she could never perform her work. She hopes to earn higher income through her loan to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy nippers, nail polish, nail brushes, cotton and pushers

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Kolab is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily.

 Kolab is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a cow to breed in order to produce a calf to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed in order to produce a calf to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina, 39, is happily married to Reynante. She operates a small sari-sari (variety) store in the village. Through her business, she hopes for a good life. But without money, her sari-sari store will not perform well. Therefore, Valentina is requesting additional capital to use in her business. A loan of PHP 5,000 will be used to buy spices, soft drinks, soy sauce, vinegar and cooking oil. She believes that through the loan, she could improve her income as well as attain her objectives in life.

loans.use: to buy spices, soft drinks, soy sauce, vinegar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath is 50 years old. She is widowed and resides with five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 daily. Four of her children are employed in a metal shop. They earn about $166 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sambath is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase cattle to butcher for sale. By doing so, she would generate additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new, bigger house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to butcher for sale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is 48 years old, married and has four children. The family resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia where she is a homemaker. Her husband is employed by a garment factory. He earns about $3 daily. Three of her children are employed by a garment factory as well. They earn about $9 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Chan is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. In addition, a part of this money will be use for building a piggery. This money would enable her to run her new business and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is 38 years old, married and has four children. The family resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making clay pots to sell for more than 10 years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer. Additionally, he is a construction worker. He earns about $3 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $6 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sophea is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children receive a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sam Rong

texts.en:
Sam Rong is 45 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in embroidery work for more than five years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband runs a poultry farm. Additionally, he is involved in fishing. He earns approximately $6 each day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $4 daily. 

Sam Rong is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase beads and threads to use in her embroidery work. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase beads and threads to use in her embroidery work.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Ra is 42 years old, married and has five children. The family resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed by a garment factory. They earn about $6 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ra is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would help her reduce the transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 36 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Kong is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more farmland for cultivating agricultural crops. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland for cultivating agricultural crops.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Ms. Fouzia is 27 years old. She is a very hardworking lady. She is running a grocery store and fully supports her family through this business. She has been running this business for the last four years. She deals with food items, e.g., rice, pulses (beans, peas, lentils, chickpeas, etc.), sugar, oil, biscuits, cold drinks, tea, milk, etc. 

She started her business with a very small amount and at the very initial stage she contacted Kashf Foundation for support for her business. She has been working with Kashf for the last three years and her repayment behavior is very good.  

For meeting the requirements of the customers, she needs extra stock of existing items and has to include the new products in her shop. For this purpose, she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She believes that if she continues working hard, she can grow this business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Family  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Family está formado por 10 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una geografía accidentada, es de clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente es amable, gentil y de un corazón muy cálido, son personas hospitalarias como nuestras socias quienes aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las que le permiten mejorar su situación económica, su mayor virtud es nunca darse por vencidas ante las adversidades que se les presentan en la vida.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Yoni, tiene 32 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Yoni desde hace 9 meses se dedica a la vende de ropa por catálogos, esta actividad la realiza recorriendo o también las vende a sus amigas y conocidas, vende su mercadería cuando se le presenta la oportunidad por lo que no tiene horario ni días de trabajo, también hace 1 mes labora en el arreglo de una casa en la cual labora 3 horas al día.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  al cual fue invitada por una amiga.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Family communal bank is comprised of ten members who live in different places in the city of Cuenca.  The city has a mountainous terrain and a cold climate.  It is bathed by four rivers, and it is the third most financially important city in the country.  It was named a World Heritage Site in December of 1999.

Its people are kind, gentle and warm-hearted.  They are hospitable people, like our members, and they still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  They work in different business activities, which allows them to improve their financial situations.  Their greatest virtue is that they never give up when facing life’s adversities.

Yoni is one of the members of this group.  She is 32 years old and married.  They have two children, ages 12 and 7.  Her first child goes to middle school, and her daughter attends a city elementary school.  Her husband has private employment.  They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live.

Yoni has been selling clothes by catalog for nine months.  She conducts this business activity by going from place to place.  She also sells to her friends and acquaintances.  She sells her merchandise when the opportunity arises; therefore she does not have a schedule or days that she works.  She has also been working for one month cleaning a house, where she works three hours a day.

This is her first loan with her communal bank, which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will use the loan to buy clothes.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 58 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling palm cakes for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $10 each day. 

Sokha is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to raise and resell when they gain weight. In addition, a part of this money will be used for buying timbers to rebuild her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a Palestinian young man. He is married and a father to two sons. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For several years, Eyad has also been a taxi driver, which has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs.

Eyad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing the engine of his taxi and improving its condition. Taking this loan will help to increase the taxi's efficiency and its ability to work extra hours and move long distances, which will enable Eyad to take more requests and improve the family's income.

Eyad is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To repair the engine of the taxi.

loans.name: Srey Man

texts.en:
Srey Man is 42 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey Man is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Saran is 59 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been in the business of selling fertilizer and fuel for more than four years, earning approximately $15 each day. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her family’s finances, Saran is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase more fuel and fertilizer to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel and fertilizer to resell

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun is 40 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $4 each day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $5 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Lun is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase groceries to resell. This money will help her run a new business and earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en:
Reth is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in a massage shop for more than three years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $8 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Reth is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice. This money will help her run a new business and earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a cosmetic shop and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 46 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling groceries for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 each day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Neang is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en:
Ngaet is 39 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been weaving hammocks to sell for more than four years, earning approximate $2 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ngaet is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the  money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mony is 43 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband sells toys and earns about $5 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mony is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to raise and resell for a profitable price when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 51 years old and she is charged with the responsibility of taking care of 7 children whom she lives with in Masindi–Uganda. She deals in poultry farming and the business has been very lucrative since she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Theft, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase feeds are her major challenges while her dreams are to educate her children and buy land to grow crops. Mary wants a loan to buy poultry feeds.

loans.use: buy  poultry feeds.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Noeurn is 31 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnong province, Cambodia. Noeurn and her husband are farmers in the village since 2010 (they are both in the picture above) earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, she has to spend on food USD 99 and USD 30 for other expenses. Noeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to buy fertilizer for her farming. By doing so, she would generate more profit to support her family. In the future, she wishes to buy a truck for transporting her vegetables easily, have a big house and help her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farming

loans.name: Walter Domingo

texts.es: El señor Walter es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica a la venta de pollo desde hace un año e invertirá el crédito en pechuga, filetes de pollo, pierna, alas, posta, deshuesada…etc.
texts.en: Walter is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling chicken for one year.  He will invest the money from this loan in chicken breasts, filets, chicken legs, wings, bone in and deboned pieces, etc…

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb is 38 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in a garment factory for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 daily. One of her children is employed in a casino and earns about $5 each day. 

Chreb is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. In addition, a part of this money will be used to purchase dirt to fill up her house’s land to prevent flooding. 

In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Saroeurn is 50 years old. She is widowed and blessed with two children. She lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her children are employed. They are a motor taxi driver and a waiter in a restaurant. They earn about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Saroeurn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase utensils to run a food stall. This money will help her acquire the security to start the new business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase utensils to run a food stall

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is 45 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been growing rice and selling sweet cake (A Kor) for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in a saw mill. He earns about $3 daily. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $10 each day. 

Oun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Ms. Bashiran is 51 years old. She is married and has six children. She has a small business of goat selling. She has been doing this business for the last 15 years. She bought kids (baby goats) at a lower price and then worked hard to raise the goats for one to two years. Then she sold the goats at a higher price.

She wanted to increase her income. For this purpose, she has to buy some more goats, so she contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase some kids (baby goats). 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase baby goats (kids).

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 42 years old. She is married and lives with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making brooms to sell for more than six years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $2 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 each day.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sina is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce their transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 34 years old, living in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her four children. She has been in the clothing business for 10 years and she started her business with her personal savings. Price fluctuations and inflation are her major challenges and her dreams are to educate her children and diversify her business to include farming. Grace wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to  sell.

loans.name: Noch

texts.en:
Noch is 58 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $25 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Noch is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. By doing so, she would be able to reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 37 years old. He is married and blessed with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been working in a saw mill for more than a year, earning approximately $10 daily. His wife is employed in a garment factory. She earns about $4 each day. In order to improve his family’s finances, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $1400 to purchase cattle for tilling his farmland. In the future, he would like to run his own saw mill and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for tilling his farmland

loans.name: Sa Aem

texts.en:
Sa Aem is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved weaving for more than a year, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns about $3 daily. 

Sa Aem is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase silk threads to use for weaving more cloth to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more silk threads to use for weaving more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a hard-working married man with four children living in Hioma, Uganda. He is the sole breadwinner for the family. He faces challenges in his business of high price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His family goal is to educate his children and venture into mechanized agriculture so as to increase his yields. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy seedlings and pay labor.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pay labor.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than 7 years, earning approximately 2 US dollars per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a coconuts and palm fruits vendor who earns about 6 USD daily.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Mom is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubaker is 43 years old and he is charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children whom he lives  with in Masindi –Uganda. He has been in maize production for 4 years. He started with farming on land that was given to him by his father and over time he has been able to buy more land. High fuel costs, transportation costs, price fluctuation and inflation are his major challenges while his dreams are to educate his children and buy land to grow more crops as well as expanding his business into new markets. Abubaker intends to use the loan facility to buy aggro inputs and also pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy aggro inputs and also pay for labor.

loans.name: Uok

texts.en:
Uok is 52 years old. She is married and resides with her daughter in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making brooms to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $1 per day. Her daughter is a garment worker who earns about $3 daily. 

Uok is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase cattle to use for tilling their farmland. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Sok Ky

texts.en:
Sok Ky is 47 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 daily. Both she and her husband are in the picture above. Her husband is a fisherman who earns about $3 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $5 each day. 

Sok Ky is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase fishing tools for her husband to use. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase fishing tools for her husband to use

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Subhi appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured next to his taxi. Mona is a 51-year-old woman, she is married to Subhi and a mother to one son. For the past year, Mona's husband has owned a taxi and worked as a taxi driver. The business has been profitable, but they also need more support to cover their family's needs. Mona wants to share in improving the family's income to provide better living conditions, so she is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing and installing a new engine for his taxi. This will improve the efficiency of the taxi and enable Mona's husband to work extra hours by taking more requests, thereby improving the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new taxi engine.

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Hakeem appears in her Kiva profile photo while he is making barbecue for customers. Lama is a 38-year-old woman; she is married to Hakeem and a mother to two sons and two daughters.

For the past ten years, Lama's husband has had a food stall making barbecue and selling it to customers in a place known for lots of activity, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Lama wants to share in improving the family's income to live with her family in better living conditions, so she is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing necessary requirements for the food stall, such as various sorts of meat, bread, and barbecue requirements. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase necessary requirements for their food stall

loans.name: Sokphal

texts.en:
Sokphal is 59 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sokphal and her husband have been farmers since 1979, earning USD 2 per day. She has four children; all her children are working in a factory, earning USD 12 per day. Each month, her family has to spend on food USD 27, utility expenses USD 8 and other expenses USD 43. 

Sokphal is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy motorbike for her son to use to get to work. This loan will help her to reduce transportation costs. In the future, she hopes she can build a big house and live in good standards.

loans.use: to buy motorbike for her son to use to get to work

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 57-year-old woman from Al Nassar, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy home cleaning products, which she will be selling to increase her income. Her goal is to improve her family's living standards. She hopes that her children will be able to continue their university education. Siham prefers not to have her photo on the internet. The above photo is of her son.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies to be sold

loans.name: Meisa

texts.en: Meisa is a 19-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy materials to make yogurt and cheese. She hopes that this will help her to continue, as well as expand, her current business selling these products. Since Meisa is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for materials to make cheese and yogurt

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 28-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For six years he has been trading in cattle and the business has been very beneficial. He says inadequate capital is affecting the business since the cows are very costly to purchase from farmers. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. John intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than five years. She is involved in breeding pigs and poultry. Approximately, she earns about $2 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer. Additionally, he is a construction worker who earns about $4 each day; both of them are in the picture above. Chanthy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to use for tilling farmland. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling farmland

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 40-year-old married woman who has four family members. She is from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements: she will be repainting her home and she wants to buy new furniture. In the future she is planning on adding another floor and she would like to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Anny

texts.en: Anny is a 36-year-old woman living in Kagadi,  Uganda.She is a government employee who works as a supplies officer, a job she has done for a period of 11 years. She dreams of educating her two children and also upgrading her studies so she can be promoted at her workplace. Anny wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are employed in a local organization. They earn about $8 daily. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sony is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use themoney saved  on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a chef who earns about $3 per day. Her husband is a jewelry seller who earns about $7 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Ry is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more jewelry for her husband to resell. By doing so, he would earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, Ry would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry for her husband to resell

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is 48 years old and a hard-working farmer who lives in the village of Gattaran. He patiently works in the field because this is his family's primary source of income, and the way in which he pays his expenses, including his children's school fees. That's why he cares a lot about his farming business. He is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to improve his farm and will use the funds to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes that this loan will allow him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Villo

texts.en:
Villo is a hard-working husband who operates a farming business. He has been carefully working this business because of his advocacy to lift up his family out of poverty. He is now 33 years old and yet he never shows success to his family. Now he is aiming for this progress through his farming business. 

To make it possible, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to purchase necessities such fertilizer and insecticides which are important in manipulating such businesses. Villo is hoping that very soon, he can prove that he can provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase necessities such fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Vanney

texts.en:
Vanney is 38 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge and fried noodle for more than five years, earning approximately $5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Vanney is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved  on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is 41 years old, married and helping to support a four-person family. She lives in Al Nasser Amman, Jordan, and is requesting a loan for JOD 500 to buy materials for a flower-arranging business. She will sell her displays to friends and neighbors. In the future, she wants to open a shop and hopes to improve her family's living standards. She prefers not to have her photo on the internet, so we see here a photo of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for materials for a flower-arranging business.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en: Isha is a 40-year-old gentleman who has an agriculture produce business which he has run for a period of 10 years. He started this business with capital he acquired from selling maize and beans. He says inadequate capital is the factor affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and buy a car to enable him ease of transport. He wants a loan to buy maize and bean produce for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize and bean produce for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying a car. He is a farmer and he started by farming on the family land but later bought his own. His main hardships are customers not paying on time, seasonal weather, and high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of buying land to grow more crops and hiring employees to to help expand his farming activities. Emmanuel needs a loan to pay workers who are preparing his land for the next planting season.

loans.use: to pay workers who are preparing his land for the next planting season.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher a 29-year-old man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop in town and sells plastics like cups, plates, and basins among other things. He is faced with challenges such as limited capital for expanding his business and price flactuations. His business goal is to open another retail shop and to expand his business into new markets. Christopher wants a loan to open another outlet in town.

loans.use: to open another outlet in town.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Phoeurn is 51 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day. Her children are construction workers as well. They earn about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phoeurn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to run a delivery service. This purchase will help her husband generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand his business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to run the delivery service.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en: Samphors is 32 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up cattle for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband runs the business of making concrete stairs to sell. He earns about $5 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Samphors is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase steel and cement for her husband to use for making stairs to sell. This money will help him produce more stairs to sell and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement and steel for her husband to use for making stairs to sell.

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po is 28 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $4 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Po is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: Johnny is a 38-year-old farmer. He is married to Mayflores and they have no living children. Despite this situation, he is preparing for future children. He is looking for a way to make a better living, so he will be blessed with children. Johnny is requesting a loan to utilize in his farming business, specifically to buy fertilizer and pesticides, which will improve and enhance his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: At 49 years old, Alexander is simply operating a farming business. He would like to develop his business in order to earn higher income. To make it achievable, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional funds for the purchase of necessities for farming such as fertilizers and pesticides. Hopefully, these items would be great factor to yield better crops in harvesting season. The income generated would be saved for his family, especially for him and his wife because they are getting older.

loans.use: to purchase items needed in farming such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is 38 years old and blessed with seven children. He is a farmer who supports his children through his farming business. But providing their needs through this source of income is really difficult for him.  His children suffer, to the extent that they weren’t able to attend school. But still, he hopes to save for them.

Now, he is asking for a loan amount of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. He is assured to yield better crops in the harvesting season through the loan in order to save for the schooling of his children. He wishes that all of them would finish  their education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Jowani

texts.en: Jowani is a 28 year old married man living Bundibugyo ,Uganda. He has a child. He has a drug shop which he has operated for 3 years and the business is at the boom stage since he enjoys the monopoly of the market. He has hardships of customers not paying on time, high fuel and transportation costs. Educating his child and building a permanent residential home for his family are his personal goals. His wish is to expand business into new markets and to own a pharmacy. Jowani wants a loan is to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Vianus

texts.en:
Vainus is married and a father of six children, aged 5-21, living in his own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. He has dependents and he is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

For 12 years, Vainus has been running a spare parts business and he started as a small-scale farmer. He saved to start his current business. He is still faced with the challenge of poor roads and bad debts. Despite the challenges he is facing, he wants to sell in bulk. Vainus needs a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is business minded person. She is married to Andres and they have been blessed with four grown up children. Two of her children currently go to school, another one is working and one is married.

Rosana makes herself busy in running her general store. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 14 years.She is really thankful to God, because she is able to sustain their basic necessities through the profits gained from her store. Some of her gained profits are used to the daily maintenance of her raised hogs, allowances of children and for the repair and maintenance of her transportation business.

Rosana would like to have continued improvement of her business, so she is asking for another loan amount of PHP50,000. This amount will be used to purchase merchandise such as cooking oils, soft drinks, breads, canned goods and soap for her general store. This will really be a great help in increasing her profits. She hopes that, as time goes by, she can maintain her general store, so that she can give her two children a quality education and a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cooking oils, soft drinks, breads, canned goods and soap for her general store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single young man. For two and a half years he has been opening a stationery store, as well as providing public services to students such as: printing and copying documents and reports, translating documents. This has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover Ahmad's expenses and cover the costs of work.

Ahmad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new copier machine and more stationery items to improve his work. This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income. Ahmad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase new copier machine and more stationery to sell.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 47 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing vegetable to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $3 each day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $5 daily. In order to improve her business, Mom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide to use in her vegetable cultivation. This purchase will help the vegetables grow well and produce a high yield. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland to use for cultivating vegetables and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide to use in vegetable her vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn is 51 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than eight years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in cultivating rice and rubber. She earns approximately $5 daily. Her husband sells Khmer traditional medicine. He earns about $2 each day. One of her children is a farm worker who earns about $5 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sokhorn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1968. Her husband passed away. She has a daughter who is in the tenth grade. Huong cooks and sells food in the market and raises pigs for a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 2,398,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more pigs to raise and sell. Then she would be able to repair her house.
The other borrower named Huong is 43 years old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to sell stuff in the market.
 
Thanh is 43 years old. He has two children. He is a soldier. He wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to open a carwash. 

Lien is 43 years old. She is a building worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sok Kea

texts.en: Sok Kea is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her mother and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling firewood and pepper trellises for more than three years, earning approximately $12 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her business, Sok Kea is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a van to use for carrying firewood to sell. This purchase will help her carry firewood in larger amounts to sell and earn more profit. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her daughter earn her bachelors degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a van to use for carrying firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new barber kit.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a twenty-seven-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For eight years now he has been selling local brew and he got start-up capital from his farming activities. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. He dreams of building a permanent home, educating his 3 children, and moving his business to the capital city.

Moses wants a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Tuyen's Group

texts.en:
Tuyen was born in 1988. She has a child who is little. Her husband is a security man. She raises pigs and poultry for a living. The total income of her family is 7,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In this first loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND to enlarge her business of raising pigs and poultry.

Van Anh is 24 years old. She has two children. She does embroidery for a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise cattle.

loans.use: to enlarge her business of raising pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Mar

texts.en:
Mar is a farmer who resides at Baybayog with his spouse and three children. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been in this business for almost 10 years now and his income goes toward his children's educational expenses. He would like to further improve his crop output. That is why he is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming. 

Someday, Mar hopes to make his crops more productive for further development of his business and his family's lives as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a hardworking father of nine children living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been operating for quite a long time and with the income earned he has been able to educate his children and pay school fees. He started as a tobacco farmer then later opened the bar using his savings from the sales. He faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and theft. His family goal is to educate all his children and he hopes to expand his business to new markets. Innocent intends to use the loan to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 58 years old and married to a farmer. They have eight children. She helps her spouse maintain the farming business which they have operated for almost 15 years now. From the farming business, they provide sustenance for their family, especially for the education of their children. Not all of the children had the opportunity to finish a degree due to financial difficulty. All her children now live elsewhere. Avelina still wants to pursue their business and not only rely on their remittances, so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to pay for land preparation and buy rice seeds and fertilizers for the sustenance of the farming business.

In the future, Avelina would like to keep producing better crops so she can harvest more and earn profits from the harvest. This will help her achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and buy rice seeds and fertilizers for sustenance of her farming business.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa is 30 years old, married and the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed but earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past four years, Safaa has been raising and selling poultry and poultry products, as well as tending a camel that she rents to customers and foreign visitors. She would like to increase her income and is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing fodder to feed the camel and some equipment that will make the camel more attractive to customers. This will increase customer demand and increase the family's income. We see Safaa here with her camel.

loans.use: to buy fodder and accessories for a camel that she rents out.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a twenty-five-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for a period of two years. His personal goal is to build a permanent home and becoming a principal. He has hardships of high taxes and low salary while his vision is buying land to grow crops and upgrading in his studies to at least a master's degree in education. John intends to use the loan to pay tuition fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for himself.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en: Waheed is 40 years old, married and the father of two sons and one daughter. He is employed but earns a salary which is too small to meet his family's needs. He is requesting a loan for $1,000 from FATEN to help cover the cost of painting his house and improving its condition. This will allow him to provide his family with a healthy and suitable place to live. We see Waheed here in his home.

loans.use: to paint and improve his house.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en: Leap is 26 years old. She is married and blessed with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Leap is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money she'll save on transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en: Chhoeurn is 51 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a farm worker who earns about $3 per day. One of her children is employed in garment factory and earns about $5 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Chhoeurn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to purchase a store at the market to sell groceries and she would also like to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 30 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is employed in a bakery shop and earns about $5 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Saron is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Rayek

texts.en:
Rayek is a 40-year-old man; he is married and a father to one son and two daughters. He is a taxi driver and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past seven years, Rayek has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Rayek is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Rayek is photographed with his herd, next to sheep he is raising.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old man; he is married and a father to one son and two daughters. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For six months now, Hussein has been opening a grocery store in addition to roasting coffee and nuts and selling them to customers, which has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of the store.

Hussein is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and  milk. This will increase sales and increase Hussein's income.

Hussein is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Saen

texts.en: Saen is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $6 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Saen is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children complete higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 37-year-old man; he is married and a father to five sons. For the past one and a half years, Mohammad has been digging, cutting and selling stones in a workshop he has, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover its costs and the family's needs.

Mohammad is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing raw stones in bulk for his workshop. This will increase the size of work and increase sales and improve the family's income, which will create better living conditions for them.

Mohammad is photographed inside his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase raw stones in bulk for his workshop

loans.name: Yurem Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yurem lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Zulmira quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 5 años. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad los cuales estudian.
Las otra integrantes son Martha quien vende ropa usada y venta de productos Avon desde hace 5 años y Luz quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The Yurem group is made up of three hardworking, entrepreneurial persons.  Zulmira is one of them and has been selling clothing for the past five years.  She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 7.  Both attend school.

The other members are Martha, who has been selling second-hand clothing and Avon products for five years; and Luz, who has had a general store for five years.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 46-year-old gentleman living in Kagadi, Uganda. He sells local brew and has been in business for a period of 4 years. Inadequate capital is the factor affecting the business however he would like to educate his two children and set up a big food store that can supply at least three districts. James wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 26 years old with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For ten years he has been selling local brew, having got start-up capital from his mother. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. He dreams of building a permanent home, educating his children, and his business plan is to expand to new markets.

Deo wants a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is a thirty-one-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a farmer and with the income earned she has been able to educate her children. Her main hardships are inadequate capital to buy the necessary inputs, price fluctuation and inflation. She has a vision of expanding her farming activities and buying modern farming equipment. Jalia wants a loan to buy beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy beans for  planting.

loans.name: Renzaho

texts.en: Renzaho is a 38-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For four years now he has been dealing in produce and he started this business with capital got from proceeds of maize and beans growing. Inadequate capital is the factor affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and buy a car to enable him to  ease transport problems with the suppliers. Renzaho intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Kihika

texts.en:
Kihika is 43 years old.  He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been running a welding business for four years having started as a carpenter. 

Kihika is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy welding materials for making doors and windows.  Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. He dreams of buying land to grow crops and educating his eight children.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Sao Run

texts.en:
Sao Run is 35 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

Sao Run is a garment worker who earns about 4 US dollars (USD) per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. He earns about 7 USD each day. Because his current motorbike is old, Sao Run is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his taxi service. This purchase will help her husband attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his taxi service.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy, 48, has been farming for 14 years. Due to insufficiency of funds, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farming necessities such as seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. He is confident this loan will help him to develop his business and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy the necessities needed in farming such as seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 36-year-old married man living Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a bar and has been in the business for one year. He got the start-up capital from his salary savings as a policeman. He is hindered by price fluctuations and inflation. His dreams are to build a permanent residential home for the family and expand business into new markets. The purpose of the loan is to refurnish his pub premises and increase the sitting space for revelers.

loans.use: To refurnish his pub premises and increase the sitting space for revelers.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson, a 41-year-old widower living in Masindi, Uganda, has a dream of educating his four children up to the university level. He owns a garage where he repairs vehicles, but his main challenges are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase enough equipment. Wilson is requesting a loan to buy repair equipment for the garage.

loans.use: to buy machines for his garage.

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed, pictured here, is a 37-year-old single young man. He is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover his needs. For the past three years, Saed has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the needs and costs.

Saed is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and fodder to feed them. This will improve the project's condition, which will lead to increased sales and improve Saed's income.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Abdou-Razak

texts.fr: Jeune homme célibataire de 23ans, Mr Abdou - Razak est brodeur de profession. Il a ouvert son atelier en 2011 et fait de jolies broderies. Il est sollicité de part et d’autres de la ville de Lomé à cause de la qualité des services rendus. Ses clients deviennent plus en plus nombreux et il manque d’outils de travail plus performant c’est pour cela il sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour s’acheter une nouvelle machine à broder. Il veut renforcer son activité, être un couturier de renom et plus tard se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: A single young man of 23, Mr Abdou - Razak is a professional embroiderer. He opened his workshop in 2011 and does lovely embroidery. He is much in demand in the town of Lomé because of the quality of his services. His clientele is growing and he does not have the best equipment; that is why he is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy a new embroidery machine. He wants to bolster his activity, become a renowned tailor, and later on, to get married.

loans.use: to buy a special sewing machine for embroidery

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Pour mettre ses 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés dans de bonnes conditions et aider son mari blanchisseur  dans les charges du ménage, madame Akouvi vend depuis 2003 de l’huile végétale, des sacs et des produits divers à domicile. C’est une femme qui est âgée de 41ans. Pour éviter les pénuries de stock et garder ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises(huile végétale et des nattes servant à fabriquer les sacs.) Avec les profits, elle voudrait stocker une quantité considérable d’huile, devenir grossiste et contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: In order to ensure her four children, of whom three are enrolled in school, of good living conditions and help her husband, a cleaner, with household expenses, since 2003, Mme Akouvi has been selling vegetable oil, woven bags and various other items out of her home. She is 41 years old.  In order to avoid shortages of supplies and to keep her customers, she is asking WAGES for a second loan to buy a stock of merchandise (vegetable oil and woven mats used for making the bags). With the profit, she would like to stock a large quantity of oil so that she can become a wholesaler and contribute to the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy oil and woven mats used for making shopping bags

loans.name: Rowel

texts.en:
Rowel is a farmer who is married and has two young children. He raises crops, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He usually earns about 10,000 PHP each harvest season, twice in a year. He uses his income to pay the school fees of his children. 

Now, he would like to strengthen his crop output, so he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help nourish his crops and someday produce abundant yields. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is operating a farming business as a source of income. He patiently works for the welfare of his four children. He dreams to have successful children someday. So he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to maximize his business. It will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. 

He will continue pursuing his children's education in order to achieve their dreams as well as to achieve a good life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat is 34 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.

Sinat is a chef who earns about 1 US dollar (USD) per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about 20 USD daily. Sinat is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work.

In the future, Sinat would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work.

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lourdes lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Claudia quien vende gallinas  desde hace 6 años  negocio que inicio con tres gallinas y poco a poco fue aumentándolo. El crédito invertirá en gallinas y alimentos para esta.
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 11, 9 y 4 años de edad los cuales estudian. Con las ganancias a logrado construir poco a poco su casa.
Los otros integran Francisco quien es comerciante de productos varios y María quien vende gallinas desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
The Lourdes group is made up of three hardworking enterprising people, one of whom is Claudia.  She has been selling chickens for the past six years, a business she began with three chickens and increased little by little.  She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens and feed.

She has four children, ages 12, 11, 9, and 4 and they all attend school.  She has been able to build a home, little by little, with her profits.

The other members of the group are Francisco, who is a merchant of various products, and Maria who has been selling chickens for 20 years.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a farmer in the Philippines; he plants and harvests rice. He manages a large crop of rice, which is his family's main source of income. Romulo has been in this type of business for 25 years and usually earns a maximum net income of 20,000 PHP per crop season.

Romulo is 58 years of age, is married and has three children. His goal in life is to earn a higher income from farming and to be able to expand his business for additional earnings for the family.

Romulo’s income from farming is not enough to sustain against his expenditures in farming. Thererfore, Romulo is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to use in growing crops.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to use in growing crops.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.en:
Aged 38, Mauricio is a farmer in Lapogan. He is married and has two children. He has been farming for eight years and currently produces rice to sell in the market. He earns 8,000 PHP every cropping season, but he finds that this amount is not enough due to the high cost of school fees for his children, as well as food expenses.

He is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for his farm. He hopes these inputs will boost his farming business to produce a good income and definitely improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
LAS ABEJITAS ES UN GRUPO MUY COMPACTO, CONFORMADO  POR 14 SOCIOS, ESTHER ES UNA DE NUESTRAS SOCIAS DE ESTA ALCANCÍA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA DE LAS MAS PUNTUALES Y RESPONSABLES DEL GRUPO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA POR MAYOR Y POR MENOR  DE ROPA TANTO DE CABALLEROS, DAMAS Y NIÑOS, ES DECIR TIENE UN PEQUEÑO BAZAR, GRACIAS A SU NEGOCIO A PODIDO  SACAR ADELANTE A SU MENOR HIJO QUE ESTA EN ETAPA ESCOLAR, YA QUE ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA.

NOS CUENTA ESTHER QUE POR LAS FESTIVIDADES PATRONALES DE SU LOCALIDAD INCREMENTAN SUS CLIENTES Y POR ESE MOTIVO ESTA SOLICITANDO EL FINANCIAMIENTO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA COMO SON PANTALONES, POLOS, CASACAS, MEDIAS, ETC., EN UN FUTURO ESTHER QUISIERA CONTAR CON UN LOCAL MAS AMPLIO PARA PODER EXHIBIR MEJOR LA MERCADERÍA CON LA QUE CUENTA.
