Далер взял в аренду помещение на первом этаже торгового комплекса, где он работает. Он просит кредит для приобретения спальных, кухонных гарнитуров и мебели для гостиной, чтобы открыть мебельный салон.
texts.en: Daler was born in 1990 in Isfara.  He is a pleasant and kind young person.  Daler has been working as a specialist in assembling furniture at a furniture salon.  Today, he wants to open his own furniture salon.  Daler leased a space on the first floor of a shopping complex, where he works.  He is requesting this loan to purchase bedroom and kitchen sets and living room furniture in order to open the furniture salon.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom and kitchen sets and living room furniture

loans.name: Tchatchouang

texts.fr: Tchatchouang est un homme de 62 ans,marié,père de 07 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 06 et 24 ans.Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école.Il a également à sa charge 03 de ses neveux.Il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 08 ans où il gère un bar. Son activité fonctionne normalement grâce à son accueil chaleureux et son expérience qui lui ont permis de conquérir une clientèle importante.Mais cependant,la croissance considérable de sa clientèle ne lui permet guère de satisfaire à la demande de celle-ci,ceci dû à la petitesse de son capital d'où l'importance de ce crédit en ce moment pour son activité,car il l'aidera à augmenter le nombre de casiers de boissons( 50) ce qui lui permetrra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle ,mais d'augmenter ses ventes et ses bénéfices.Elle réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tchatchouang is a 62-year-old man and the father of seven children, from 6 to 24 years old. Three of his children still go to school. He also has three of his nephews to support. He has been a merchant in a district in the capital for eight years where he manages a bar. His business is operating normally, thanks to his warm accommodations and his experience, which enables him to capture a significant customer base. 

However, the considerable growth of his customer base barely allows him to meet the demand because of his meager capital funds. And so the loan at this time is important for his business, since it will help him to increase the number of cases of drinks (50), which will enable him not only to meet customer demand but also to increase his sales and his profits. 

He will reinvest part of his profits in his business, and the rest will enable him to meet the day-to-day needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy 50 cases of drinks

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a married lady with two children. She has been connected with Kashf Foundation for the last four years and is continuing her fourth loan cycle. 

To support her family, she decided to utilize her sewing capability. For this purpose she definitely required financial assistance, so she approached Kashf Foundation. Kashf helped her to establish a small sewing business at her home. 

Now she would like to expand her business by engaging more women with her. To purchase the required equipment for this purpose, she needs an amount of Rs. 30,000 as a loan.

Ms. Yasmeen is a deserving lady with a strong motive to support her family economically. She is looking forward to keeping her relationship with Kashf, finding it a truly helping hand that respects the dignity of its clients.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, and fancy laces for sewing.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha morada, jugo de níspero y varios otros licuados y jugos. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú Guillermina ha disfrutado mucho de las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal, especialmente las lecciones sobre los ahorros y la importancia de valorarse como mujer. Su sueño para el futuro es progresar al lado de su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes que son necesarios para la preparación de sus productos como diversas frutas, maíz morado, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls). She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Guillermina has been a member of FINCA Peru for six years and earns her living by selling “chicha morada” (a traditional beverage made from purple corn), loquat juice, and various other beverages. Throughout the entire time that she has been a member of FINCA Peru, Guillermina has greatly enjoyed the training sessions that have been provided through her Communal Bank, especially the lectures on savings and the importance of valuing oneself as a woman.

Her dream for the future is to make progress alongside her family. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of necessary ingredients for preparing her products such as various fruits, purple corn, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy various fruits, purple corn, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.fr: Isaac est un jeune homme de 29 ans,marié,père d'un enfant âgé de 02 ans.Il a également sous sa charge une autre personne.Il est commerçant dans un marché de la capitale depuis 12 ans déjà où il vend des oignons et ail en détail.la vente en détail est une activité qui lui réussit assez bien,car sa qualité de battant et son expérience lui ont permis d'avoir au fil des années une clientèle importante.Mais cependant au vue de la demande de plus en plus grandissante, il voudrait se lancer dans la vente en gros sans pour autant laisser le détail.C'est donc pour cela qu'il sollicite ce crédit car cela lui permettra d'acheter en gros des sacs d'oignons et ail afin de revendre tant en gros qu'en détail,ce qui  augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais également  ses bénéfices.Il réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans son activité en vue de l'agrandir et de la diversifier et l'autre partie l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Isaac is a young man aged 29, who is a married father of a 2-year-old child. He also has another person under his care. He has worked in a market in the capital for 12 years, where he sells onion and garlic on a retail basis. His retail sale business has done fairly well, and his fighting spirit and experience have brought him a significant amount of customers over the years. 

However, in light of the constantly growing demand from his customers, he would like to start working in wholesale, while keeping his retail business going. This is why he has requested this loan, which will allow him to buy bags of onion and garlic wholesale. This will increase not only his sales, but also his profits. He will reinvest part of these profits to expand and diversify his business, and will use the rest to help provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy bags of onions and garlic.

loans.name: Megain

texts.fr: Megain est une dame âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants parmi lesquels deux vont à l'école. Elle a pour activité un salon de couture dans lequel elle confectionne les robes communément appelées "Kabas". Elle bénéficie de 20 ans d'expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui a permise d'avoir une clientèle considérable et fidèle. Elle travaille sur commande et elle fait également de l'exposition-vente. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des rouleaux de tissus pour renforcer son stock de matières premières afin d'augmenter sa capacité productive. Ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle beaucoup plus rapidement. Elle envisage réinjecter les revenus générés dans son activité pour la faire grandir davantage.
texts.en:
Megain is a 52-year-old woman, who is a married mother of four children, two of whom go to school. Her business is a dressmaking store, where she makes dresses known locally as "Kabas". She has 20 years’ experience in this field, which has brought her a large number of loyal customers. She works to order, and also displays her items for sale.

Megain would like to use her loan to buy rolls of fabric to increase her stock of raw materials. This will allow her to increase her production capacity, which will mean that she can meet her customers’ requests much more quickly. She plans to reinvest the profits she generates in her business, so that she can expand it even more.

loans.use: To buy rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Zura

texts.ru: Зуре 60 лет, вдова. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Зура занимается животноводством.  Начатое 28 лет  назад со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство насчитывает на сегодня 4 дойные коровы, 4 лошади и приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Также, Зура обрабатывает 1,20 га земли с картофелем и зерновыми культурами. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров. Доходы Зура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Zura is 60 years old, a widow.  To provide a source of income for the family, she is involved in animal husbandry.  The business, started 28 years ago with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS), today contains four dairy cows and four horses and yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products.  Zura also works on 1.20 hectares of land, growing potatoes and cereal crops.  In order to further develop her business, Zura requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy three dairy cows.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase three dairy cows

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a married lady with three children. Her daughters are school-going and her son is doing a job in a mill. She is running a general store with the help of her husband.

Ms. Irshad has been linked with Kashf Foundation for the last two years and is in her second loan cycle. She thought to make an expansion to her business, which requires finance. So she applied for a loan amount of Rs. 30,000 to accomplish her motive.

With this accomplishment, she would definitely be able to give her children a sustainable position in society by getting them a better quality of education.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Fatou Fall's Group

texts.fr:
Le bv a été crée le 12/12/2009 est constitué par des femmes qui habitent la même zone.Elles sont solidaires entre elles; et font comme activité principale le commerce.
Fatou ; âgée de 45 ans est mariée et mère de trois garçons et de deux filles.Debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant la main fait comme activité le commerce de détail.
Avec son prêt elle envisage de faire comme activité la vente de parfums; de l'encens et de la glace.Elle compte acheter des paquets de six bouteilles et de douze;un sceau d'encens de cinq kilos; un sac de sucre et un sac de pain de singe pour la préparation de la crème glacée.
Les bénéfices générées lui permet de renforcer son épargne, de payer les intérêts mensuels de son prêt, et d'acheter des fournitures scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on 12 December 2009, and its members are all women who live in the same area. They feel solidarity with one another, and their main business is retail.

Fatou is 45 years of age, and is a married mother of three sons and two daughters. She is pictured standing on the extreme right of the photo, with her hand raised. Her business is retail, and with her loan she plans to work selling perfumes, incense and ice cream. She plans to buy packets containing 12 and 6 bottles of fragrances, a 5-kilo bucket of incense, a bag of sugar and a bag of baobab fruit to make the ice cream. The profits generated will allow her to increase her savings, pay the monthly interest on her loan, and buy school equipment for her children.

loans.use: To buy fragrances and incense

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo es casado, tiene 35 años de edad, curso los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría y la atención a tienda en general, inició la tejeduría con su señor padre y lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar hilos de diferentes colores y clases para tejido de cortes, espera ver su negocio grande en un próximo futuro.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Pablo is 35 years old, married, and completed two years of his elementary school education. He has four children, three of whom are studying.

Juan Pablo is a weaver and also manages a general store. He started weaving alongside his father and has five years of experience. Juan Pablo is requesting a loan in order to buy different types of thread in various colors for making woven skirts. He hopes to see his business grow in the near future.

loans.use: to buy various types and colors of thread for weaving.

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es:
Jose Patricio tiene 37 años, Es soltero vive solo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Jose Patricio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz además se dedica a la cría de animales cómo cerdos, pollos. Compra sus productos en la ciudad de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, fertilizantes para los cultivos y poder arrendar terreno.   Con el apoyo del crédito podrá sembrar y obtener mejores utilidades. Su sueño es tener dinero para construir la casa y ayudar a los demás.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Jose Patricio is 37 years old, single, and lives alone in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Luchando for Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for a Same Cause), which is located in the neighborhood of La Primavera in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Jose Patricio is a farmer who grows corn and rice. In addition, he raises animals such as pigs and chickens. He buys his supplies in the city of Ventanas. Jose Patricio is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, urea, compost, and fertilizers for his crops and to prepare his land so that it can be leased. With the help of his loan, he will be able to start planting and eventually obtain better profits. His dream is to have money for building a house and helping others.

In his free time, Jose Patricio enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPA” iniciará el ciclo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Venancia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de carteras, venta de papa, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, elaboración de pan producción de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Venancia es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ganadería desde hace varios años, siendo este un negocio familiar que sigue trabajando.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que comprará de las personas que le ofrecen en su domicilio y posteriormente los criará para comercializarlo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Papa” (Potato Flower) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Venancia as the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as making purses, selling potatoes, selling food, weaving blankets, and producing bread.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Venancia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter who came to her house. At the moment, Venancia has a cattle business that she has managed for several years. This is a family business where she continues to work.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying cattle. She will purchase the animals from individuals who come to her home to sell them. Venancia will then raise these animals until they are ready to be sold. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Venancia is married and has two children.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, Venancia said that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste, tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 2 hijos (1 varón y una mujer). Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años. Ella es dueña de una bodega en su comunidad donde vende dulces, abarrotes, accesorios para el hogar y útiles escolares. Ella dice que en el tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ella ha aprendido a ahorrar y a ser puntual. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio como azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, fideos, harina, golosinas, bebidas, útiles escolares, accesorios para el hogar, etc.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Communal Bank “Maria Celeste”. She is 45 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Vicenta has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and is the owner of a store in her community where she sells candy, groceries, household accessories, and school supplies. She says that during her time as a member of FINCA Peru, she has learned how to save and be punctual.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise for her business such as sugar, rice, oil, milk, noodles, flour, sweets, beverages, school supplies, home accessories, and other products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, milk, noodles, flour, sweets, beverages, school supplies, home accessories, and other products.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Ms. Fouzia is a hardworking lady with two children. Both children are school-going. 

She is a master in embroidery and sewing, so she thought to utilize her skills in financial terms. Four years ago she opened a small boutique in her home, where she sells her own handmade embroidered and sewn garments. She also makes dresses to order. 

Ms. Fouzia requested a loan amount of Rs. 30,000 to buy another better quality machine, as she also teaches this art to other girls of the community.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Ofelia esta casada, tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos el cual estudia, se dedica a la confección de tejido, como también al comercio de atención a una tienda en general, lleva 2 años de experiencia con la tienda.

Solicita un préstamo que se servirá para comprar mas productos para la tienda: aguas gaseosa, jugos, golosinas, cereales, lácteos, etc. y así tener variedad y vender mas, en el futuro quiere tener una abarrotaría.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Ofelia is 23 years old, married, and completed two years of her elementary school education. She has one child who is studying. Ana Ofelia is a weaver who also manages a general store. She has two years of experience in managing her store.

Ana Ofelia is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products for her store such as water, sodas, juices, sweets, grains, dairy products, and other items so that she can have variety and sell more. In the future, she wants to have a grocery business.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, juices, sweets, grains, dairy products, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres de Negocio lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Sara quien se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace 7 años que en un principio su esposo no quería que incursionará en este negocio sino en otro actualmente él le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en cerdo.
Las otras integrantes son Mildre quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, María Dolores quien se dedica a los derivados del cerdo y Jesenia quien tiene una moto taxi y vende repostería.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres de Negocio” (Women of Business) consists of four hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Sara, who has been butchering pigs for seven years. Her husband initially did not want to be involved in this business, but now he provides assistance. Sara’s loan will be invested in pigs.

The other members are as follows: • Mildred sells clothing. • María Dolores makes pork products. • Jesenia owns a motorcycle taxi and sells desserts.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Luis Heriberto

texts.es:
Luis Heriberto es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 20, 19, 8 y 4 años los cuales estudian los mayores en la universidad y los menores en primaria y preescolar.
Él está solicitando este crédito para realizar un sumidero para su hogar y así instalar un inodoro.
texts.en: Luis Heriberto is a hardworking and enterprising man.  He is married and has four children aged 4, 8, 19 and 20.  The older two are in college, the 8-year-old is in elementary school, and the 4-year-old is in preschool. He is seeking this loan so that he can install a drain pipe in his house, which will allow him to install a toilet.

loans.use: to install a drain pipe.

loans.name: Milton Geronimo

texts.es: Milton empezó su negocio en el que vende artesanías hace 10 años, primero recorría diversos sectores de Playas siendo la ruta turística la que más visitaba. Con el paso de los años y la dedicación que le puso al negocio pudo abrir un puesto fijo en el malecón luego de que regenerara el sector y le dieran facilidades. El escogió este negocio por sus hermanos y familiares quienes se dedican a lo mismo. Como ahora está casado su esposa es quien le ayuda en la atención, él le enseño la forma de trabajar y juntos mantienen el hogar. Empiezan a colocar el puesto a las ocho de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche, como es un lugar turístico la mayoría de los comercios cierran tarde. Entre las artesanías que ofrece están los artículos elaborados de tagua, pulseras, cadenas, pinchos, anillos de acero, collares etc. La zona donde él trabaja es muy competitiva por lo que se tiene que actualizar y comprar mercadería moderna para no decaer en las ventas es por eso que está solicitando el crédito. A futuro espera surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar los ingresos y salir adelante con su familia mejorando su condición económica.
texts.en:
Milton started out with his business selling handicrafts 10 years ago.  He used to go around the various neighborhoods of Playas, since this is a tourist route that is widely visited.  Over the years, and with the dedication he put into his business, he was able to open a fixed stall on the seafront boardwalk after the area was regenerated and they gave him the facility.  He chose this business because his siblings and relatives worked in the same trade.  As he is now married, his wife is the one who helps him with the business.  He taught her to do this work, and together they support their household.  

They start to set up their stall at 8 in the morning, and they work there until 10 at night.  As this is a tourist town, most of the businesses close late.  Among the handicrafts that they sell are items carved from tagua nuts, bracelets, chains, decorative hair sticks, steel rings, necklaces, etc.  The neighborhood where they work is very competitive, and so they have to update their merchandise by purchasing modern items so that their sales do not diminish.  This is the reason why they are requesting this loan.  In the future, Milton hopes to increase his business inventory so that he can have more sales and get ahead with his family by improving their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy crafts made from tagua nuts, bracelets, chains, hair sticks, steel rings and necklaces

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro a sus 31 años se dedica a la pesca deportiva y paseos acuáticos en su natal Libertad. Empezó este negocio desde muy joven cuando se caso a los 18 años de edad, como adquirió responsabilidades su padre le enseño el manejo de las embarcaciones para que se hiciera  cargo de ellas y pudiera brindar un futuro estable a su familia. Con el paso del tiempo y el auge turístico decidió dejar la pesca y a dar servicio de paseos. El trabaja con un ayudante de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. El costo que tienen los paseos en su embarcación es de $ 5.00 por persona y en la pesca deportiva cobra $ 35.00 con esto cubre el alquiler de las cañas y los cebos que utilizan también el tiempo de espera que brinda para disfrutar del deporte. Tiene varios años dedicándose al negocio por lo que el préstamo lo solicita para comprar un motor más fuerte, también cañas modernas y así mejorar el servicio. A futuro tiene planeado mejorar su vivienda que hace poco pudo comprar para mejorar la condición de vida que brinda a su familia.
texts.en: Pedro, 31, works in sports fishing and aquatic tours in his native Libertad.  He started this business since he was very young; when he got married at the age of 18 and acquired responsibilities his father taught him to handle boats so that he could manage them and provide a stable future for his family.  With the passage of time, aquatic tourism grew so he decided to leave fishing aside and go into the excursion business.  He works with an assistant’s help from Monday through Friday from 9am until 5pm.  He charges $5.00 per person on his boat and for sports fishing he charges $35.00.  This covers the cost of fishing rod rental and bait used plus the waiting time involved in enjoying this sport.  He’s been in this business for several years so the loan requested is to buy a more powerful engine as well as modern fishing rods to improve service.  In the future he plans to make improvements to the house he was able to buy recently to improve the living conditions he offers his family.

loans.use: to buy a motor and fishing rods.

loans.name: Leyton Moises

texts.es: Leyton de 26 años vive en Libertad dedicándose al alquiler de tablas de surf. Empezó aprendiendo el surf en las playas de Montañita que queda a 30 minutos de viaje, esta localidad es conocida por los deportistas por sus olas, cuando aprendió las técnicas regreso a su ciudad natal empezando a dar clases, la acogida que recibió lo llevo a empezar el negocio. En ese lapso de tiempo conoció a su actual enamorada con quien planea casarse a finales de este año, ella fue la que le animo y presto el dinero con lo que pudo adquirir un pequeño local en Montañita. El local lo atiende con dos ayudantes ya que dan servicio de tablas de surf, tablas  bodyboard y vende accesorios. Uno de sus mayores problemas es el clima ya que su negocio depende el oleaje. El préstamo que está solicitando lo utilizara para la compra de tablas y accesorios así como herramientas para dar mejor servicio de reparación y mantenimiento. Su mayor sueño es poner una boutique con ropa y accesorios para surfistas.
texts.en: Leyton, 26, lives in Libertad and works renting surfboards.  He learned to surf at the Montañita beach that’s a 30-minute trip away.  This location is known by sportsmen for its waves.  When he learned the techniques he returned home to start teaching classes and the welcome he got led him to start his business.  In this period of time he met his current girlfriend who he plans to marry at the end of this year.  She was who encouraged him and lent him the money to acquire a small locale in Montañita.  He tends to his shop with help from two assistants because they provide surfboard services, body boards and also sell accessories.  One of his biggest problems is the weather because his business depends on the waves.  He will use the loan he’s requesting to buy boards and accessories as well as tools to provide better repair and maintenance services.  His greatest dream is to open a boutique with clothes and accessories for surfers.

loans.use: to buy surfboards, bodyboards and accessories.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana tiene 33 años y se dedica hacer trenzas y tatuajes en La Libertad. Aprendió desde muy joven cuando le ayudaba a su mamá quien se dedicaba a este negocio, con el pasar del tiempo y después de casarse se independizo para ayudar a su esposo económicamente. Recorre las playas enseñando las extensiones de cabello que vende y ofreciendo los servicios, por hacer trenzas cobra $ 2.00 dependiendo del largo, los tatuajes a $ 4.00 son hechos de manera artesanal con pintura resistente al agua pero que no daña el organismo y que sale con agua y jabón. El negocio lo realiza con su esposo quien también elabora tranzas y vende mariscos, realiza ambos negocios porque tiene una hija a la cual le quiere brindar mejores oportunidades que ella no tuvo. La competencia en el sector es muy fuerte pero la mantiene porque es rentable. Con el préstamo que solicita comprar pintura, perlas, hilos, amuletos para la venta, en el futuro espera poder alquilar una carpa con sillas para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Ana, 33, works braiding hair and applying tattoos in La Libertad.  She learned when she was young helping her mother who was in the same business.  With the passage of time and after getting married she became independent to help her husband economically.  She walks along the beach displaying the hair extensions she sells and offering her services.  She charges $2.00 to weave a braid depending on length.  The tattoos cost $4.00 and are made in an artisanal way with water resistant paint that’s harmless to the organism and that washes off with soap and water.  She runs the business with her husband who also braids hair and sells seafood.  She does both businesses because she has a daughter that she wants to provide with better opportunities than the ones she had herself.  Competition in the sector is very strong but she stays in it because it’s profitable.  She will use the requested loan to buy paint, pearls, thread and charms to sell.  In the future she hopes to rent a tent with chairs in order to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy paint, pearls, thread and charms.

loans.name: Eduardo David

texts.es: Eduardo vive en la hermosa localidad Data de Villamil que pertenece a Playas, es una zona costera donde hay pequeños asentamientos ya que al ser turístico hay gran cantidad de hoteles y complejos. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio dependiendo de la temporada y las oportunidades que se le presenten. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ensaladas de fruta en tarrinas las cuales venden en un triciclo que acondiciona para esta labor, vende también carne de res y pollo en su barrio. Es un hombre muy versátil se lo puede saber por la variedad de conocimientos que tiene, incluso da clases de guitarra y brinda serenatas. El negocio la realiza junto a su esposa quien recibe el pedido y supervisa la entrega cuando no se dedica a su negocio. Con el préstamo él va a comprar frutas, carnes, pollos, tarrinas y fundas para la venta. Su reto a futuro es terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Eduardo lives in the beautiful location of Data de Villamil belonging to Playas.  It’s a coastal zone with small settlements.  Since it’s a tourist zone there are a large number of hotels and housing developments.  He’s always been a merchant according to the season and opportunities that present themselves.  He currently works selling tubs of fruit salad from a three-wheeled cart he modified for this type of work; he also sells beef and chicken in his neighborhood.  He’s very versatile and this can be seen in the variety of skills he has; he even gives guitar lessons and provides serenades.  He runs the business with his wife who takes orders ad supervises deliveries when he’s otherwise engaged.  He will use the loan to buy fruit, meat, chickens, tubs and bags for the sales.  His future challenge is to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, meat, chicken, tubs and bags.

loans.name: Norma Alejandrina

texts.es: Norma comenzó el comercio trabajando como vendedora informal en la bahía de Guayaquil, sector muy conocido por ser el lugar donde se encuentra de todo. Como informal no le iba muy bien porque estaba expuesta a los robos con lo que tenia perdida, ella se fijo una meta en concreto reuniendo el dinero para abrir un local en el cual ahora vende pantalones, blusas, interior, medias. El local está ubicado cerca de casa por lo que abre desde las 8 am hasta las 9 pm de lunes a sábado y los domingo de 8 a 1 de la tarde porque hay menos movimiento. Con la apertura de su local ella se siente más contenta ya que descansa y brinda una mejor atención, también tiene sus beneficios ya que la ropa que tiene no se maltrata y puede exhibirla mejor. Norma es viuda y sus hijos son mayores de edad por lo que tener el negocio la hace sentirse útil, el préstamo al que esta accediendo lo utilizara para la compra de ropa  y así surtir mejor el negocio.
texts.en: Norma began working as an informal salesperson in La Bahía de Guayaquil, a sector that’s very well-known because everything can be found there.  Because she was informal she didn’t do too well because she was exposed to robberies and she incurred losses that way.  She set a concrete goal for herself: to save money in order to open a locale from which to sell pants, blouses, underwear and stockings.  The locale is located near her house so she opens from 8am until 9pm from Monday through Saturday and from 8am until 1pm on Sundays because there’s less movement then.  With the opening of her store she feels happier because she can rest and provide better service.  It’s also a benefit in that her clothes don’t get damaged and she can display them better.  Norma is a widow and her children are adults so having the business makes her feel useful.  She will use the loan she’s getting to buy clothes to better stock her store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Victor Fidel

texts.es: Victor tiene un taller de ebanistería en su casa ubicada en Isla Trinitaria, viene en una cooperativa que tiene poco tiempo por lo que su casa es propia. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a mantenido el negocio familiar ya que al principio era de su padre. Esta actividad le gusta y cuando tiene pedidos deja mucha rentabilidad, lo único que necesita es madera y su inagotable imaginación para la creación de muebles y cómodas laboradas. Trabaja en su taller desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde en compañía de un hijo a quien le gusta también la actividad. La mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el clima cuando llueve ya que las calles no están pavimentadas lo que le dificulta el traslado de sus piezas. El préstamo que solicita la empleara para la compra de madera, cemento y materiales para poder trabajar. Le gustaría a futuro poder construir un segundo piso para en la parte baja ampliar su taller con la compra de otra máquina.
texts.en:
Victor has a carpentry shop at his house on Isla Trinitaria. He has been in a cooperative for a short time, and his house is his own.  With great effort and dedication he has maintained the family business because in the beginning it was his father’s.

He likes this business activity, and when he has orders it is very profitable.  The only thing he needs is wood and his boundless imagination in order to create furniture and comfortable assignments.

He works in his shop from nine in the morning until five in the afternoon.  He works with his son, who also likes the business activity.  The biggest difficulty he faces is the climate.  When it rains the streets, which are not paved, make it difficult to transport his pieces.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy wood, cement, and materials to be able to work.  In the future he would like to build a second floor on the lower lever and expand his shop with the purchase of another machine.

loans.use: to buy wood, cement, and materials to be able to work.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es: Jose empezó a trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar económica a su familia, empezó como oficial de pintura y empaste con lo que aprendió mucho de decoración, luego con dedicación y persistencia se independizo. A sus 36 años Jose tiene mayores obligaciones que cuando era joven por lo cual incursiono en el comercio vendiendo zapatos y cosméticos bajo pedido. Su tiempo lo tiene distribuido por lo que de lunes a viernes se dedica a la pintura y decoración y los fines de semana entrega los pedidos que recibe. No está casado pero si tiene hijos a quienes respalda económicamente, por lo cual en su negocio tiene personas que trabajan con el de esa manera aumenta sus ventas. El crédito al que está aplicando lo utilizara para la compra de sandalias y cosméticos, también comprar herramientas que necesita para pintar. Espera a futuro continuar con ambos negocios y así poder terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
When he was very young Jose started working in order to help his family financially.  He started as a painting and plastering worker.  He learned a lot about decoration, and then, with dedication and persistence, he became independent.

At 36 years of age, Jose has greater obligations than he did when he was young.  Therefore, he started his business of selling shoes and cosmetics by order.  He spends Mondays through Fridays on painting and decoration, and on the week-ends he delivers the orders he receives.

He is not married, but he has children whom he financially supports.  He has people in his business who work with him, and this increases his sales.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy sandals and cosmetics.  He will also buy tools he needs for painting.  He hopes to continue both businesses in the future.  That way he will be able to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy sandals and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sin Límites  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sin Límites está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, han formado el grupo porque son conocidos y familiares, se caracterizan por ser mujeres trabajadoras y muy emprendedoras que trabajan diariamente para mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ciudad clima frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, la arquitectura de esta ciudad es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente aun mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Sandra, tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus urbano, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Sandra se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes, pollos y cerdos, también labora en la agricultura pero lo que produce es solo para el consumo de su hogar. Este trabajo le da el tiempo para pasar en casa al cuidado de su familia.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos, cerdos y alimento para animales.

Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
The “Sin Límites” (No Limits) communal bank has 9 female members and one male member who live in different places in the city of Cuenca and have formed a group because they are acquaintances and family members.  They are noted for being very hardworking, enterprising women who work daily to improve their homes’ economic conditions.  They live in the city of Cuenca which has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since 1999.  It’s a city with a cold climate but its residents are warmhearted.  The city’s architecture is a mixture of colonial and modern and the people still preserve their culture and traditions.

One of the group members is Sandra, 28.  She’s married and has two children who are 4 years and 1 year old.  Her husband is a driver by profession and works driving a city bus.  They own their house.

Sandra raises guinea pigs, chickens and pigs to sell and also works in agriculture but what she grows is only for household consumption.  This work gives her time to spend at home caring for her family.

This is the first loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she will use it to buy guinea pigs, chicks, pigs and animal feed.  Her goal is to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicks, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Mi Esperanza Group

texts.es: Liliana tiene 38 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Mi Esperanza, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Liliana inicio su negocio desde hace 10 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de abarrotería en general, el negocio lo abre de 6:00 am y cierra a las 9:00 pm, una de las desventajas es que tiene competencia y le quitan la clientela, por lo que ella solicita el préstamo para surtir la pulpería y no perder mas clientes. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, refrescos, pastas, jabones, harina, churros, aceite  vegetal, verduras, entre otras cosas. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá tener bien surtido su negocio y le generara más ganancias por lo que podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos y a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. La meta de Liliana es mantener bien surtido su negocio para poder atraer más clientes. Liliana ha solicitado cuatro ciclos en Fama y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Liliana, 38, is a member of the “Mi Esperanza” (My Hope) communal bank.  She’s married and has three children.  Her husband works in agriculture.  

Liliana started her business ten years ago.  She sells groceries in general.  She opens at 6am and closes at 9pm.  One of her disadvantages is that she has competition and she loses customers to it which is why she’s asking for a loan to stock her grocery store in order to not lose any more customers.  

She will use the requested loan to buy rice, soft-drinks, pasta, soap, flour, snacks, vegetable oil and vegetables, among other things.  With help from this loan she will be able to have her store better stocked and will generate more profits to continue supporting her children and helping her husband with household expenses.  

Liliana’s goal is to keep the store well-stocked to attract more customers.  Liliana has requested four Fama cycles and has made her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general.

loans.name: Munyika Group

texts.fr:
Claudette fait partie du groupe Munyika et habite dans la province de Cibitoke. Elle a 24 ans et est mariée à  Cyrille, un commerçant des habits et des chaussures. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 6 ans.

Elle fait le commerce des habits et des chaussures depuis 5ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits et de chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait faire des achats des habits  et des  chaussures à revendre, dans  une autre province : Ngozi.
texts.en:
Claudette is part of the Munyika group, and lives in the province of Cibitoke. She is 24 years of age and is married to Cyrille, a clothing and shoe retailer. Together they have three children, aged between 1 and 6.

Claudette works selling clothing and shoes, and has done so for five years. This is her fourth loan with Turame. She plans to use the Kiva loan she will obtain to buy lots of clothing and shoes for resale, so she can earn more. 

Over the coming years, Claudette would like to buy clothing and shoes for resale in another province (Ngozi).

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy lots of clothing and shoes, which she will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de chaussures, mèches et des ustensiles de cuisine à domicile et de façon ambulante, madame Adjoa est mariée à un chauffeur et ils ont en charge 02 enfants âgés de 05 et 02ans. Elle même a 26ans. Elle rencontre par moment la concurrence sur le terrain. Afin de pallier à ce problème, elle sollicite dans notre institution un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandise (ustensiles de cuisine, chaussures et mèches).Elle veut agrandir la boutique et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Adjoa works reselling shoes, hair extensions and kitchen utensils at home and on the street. She is married to a driver, and together they have two children under their care, aged 5 and 2. Adjoa herself is 26 years of age. She currently faces competition in the area. To alleviate this problem, Adjoa has requested her first loan from this institution to buy supplies (kitchen utensils, shoes and hair extensions). She would like to expand her store, as well as to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, shoes and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Las Negras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las negras lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Elizabeth quien es comerciante ambulante con la compra de frutas, verduras y carne desde hace 10 años en el que invertirá el crédito en mercadería. Ella está casada y tiene cinco hijos de 12, 11, 7, 3 y 1 año de edad respectivamente.
Con el crédito anterior invirtió en pesas, mesa, canastas entre otras cosas que necesitaba.
Las otras integrantes son Yolanda quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 5 años y Verónica quien vende discos y alquiler de nintendo desde hace 6 años.
texts.en: Three hardworking, enterprising people form the “Las Negras” group.  One of them is Elizabeth who’s a street vendor.  She’s been selling fruit, vegetables and meat for the last ten years and will use the loan to buy merchandise.  She’s married and has five children whose ages are 12, 11, 7, 3 and 1 respectively. She used the previous loan to buy scales, a table and baskets, among other things she needed.  The other group members are Yolanda who has had a grocery store for five years and Verónica who has been selling records and leasing Nintendo for six years.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetabes and meat

loans.name: Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: El Sr. Guillermo  es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos, Guillermo  tiene 54 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Esperanza de vida con el Futuro” grupo  conformado por 9  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Guillermo  trabaja desde hace 20 años en la venta de Locería es decir platos tazas adornos vasos, Guillermo compra por mayor y los vende a domicilio este negocio surge a raíz de que su esposa falleció y el se quedo con sus 4 hijos y tenía que mantenerlos y cuidarlos a la vez es así que trabajo muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar Locería (Platos, vasos adornos) .Guillermo  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Guillermo has a live-in partner and 4 children. He is 54 years old and is a member of the communal bank "Esperanza de vida con el Futuro" (Hope of life with the future), a group made up of 9 members who work in various business activities. 

Guillermo has worked for the last 20 years selling crockery, including plates, cups, and decorated vases. Guillermo purchases goods at wholesale and sells them door-to-door. He started this business after his wife passed away and he was left to support and take care of his 4 children. This is why he works very hard to help his children get ahead, and thanks to his efforts and dedication he now earns more income and his children were able to go to school. Little by little he bought things for his home, and above all his family has a better quality of life. 

With the goal of continuing to grow, he has asked for a new loan to purchase crockery (plates, decorated vases). Guillermo will achieve his goals with lots of work and effort, and with the help of EDAPROSPO's loans.

loans.use: to buy pottery (plates, decorated vases)

loans.name: Maríela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela quien se dedica al comercio de comida rápida y tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 6 años, negocios en lo que invertirá el crédito. Ella tiene dos hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad.
Ella con el crédito anterior compro vitrinas y productos.
texts.en:
Mariela works in the fast food business and has had a beauty salon for 6 years. She will invest the loan in both businesses. 

She has two children, who are 19 and 12 years old. She purchased display cases and products with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for both businesses.

loans.name: Las Del Río  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las del Rio está formado por 7 mujeres todas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que laboran en su mayoría en los trabajos del campo, también crían y venden animales, estas actividades las han aprendido de sus padres. Ellas aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son también mujeres amables y de un corazón cálido. Viven por la parroquia Jadán que esta ubica a 28 km de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió y tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la belleza de la naturaleza.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosario, tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos de 25, 22, 19, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segunda hija estudia a distancia y también trabaja, su tercer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus tres siguientes hijos estudian en el colegio y tres en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica a cuidar a su familia y también siembra tomates, estas plantas le dan fruto cada 4 meses, se encuentra en el negocio hace 12 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo, también siembra verduras y cría cerdos, cuyes y ganado. Tanto las verduras como los animales son para la venta.
 
Se encuentra en es banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un  invernadero.
 
Su meta es  seguir creciendo en los cultivos de tomates.
texts.en:
The “Las del Río” (The Ones from the River) communal bank has 7 members, all women.  They are hardworking and enterprising.  Most of them work in the fields and also raise animals to sell.  They’ve learned these activities from their parents.  They still preserve their native culture and traditions and are also kind, warmhearted women.  They live in Jadán Parish located 28 kilometers from the city of Cuenca.  This parish has a cold climate and several places to visit and enjoy nature.

One of this group’s members is María Rosario, 41.  She’s married and has had ten children whose ages are 25, 22, 19, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 and 2.  Her oldest son is married and lives on his own.  Her second daughter is studying away and also works.  Her third son works and helps out economically.  Her next three attend secondary school and the next three attend the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a day laborer and she owns the house she lives in.

María works caring for her family but also grows tomatoes.  These plants produce fruit every four months.  She’s been in business 12 years and works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She also grows vegetables and raises pigs, cattle and guinea pigs.  Both the vegetables and the animals are to be sold.

She’s been in the communal bank for two years and will use her new loan to build a nursery.  Her goal is to continue growing with the tomato crops.

loans.use: to build a plant nursery.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Mrs. Sidra is a very hardworking lady. She is working very hard to improve the status of her family. She is 29 years old. She is in the business of sewing clothes. 

Approximately six years ago she decided to start her own business. She has a clothing and tailoring business. She purchases cloth from the market and sews the cloth and sells it to the customers at a very reasonable price. 

Owing to the good quality of her work, she gets many orders from her customers on a regular basis. She has many orders in her hand, and for completing these orders she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan rupees for purchase of cloth and raw material.
	
She is working hard to expand her business and increase the income for her household, so that her whole family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and raw material for sewing.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela, from the village of Sillawit, is 60 years old and widowed. Miguela owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately P4,000 a month.

In order to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities, Miguela is requesting a loan of P9,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, spices, drinks, and snack foods to sell in their village.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, spices, drinks, and snack foods to sell in their village.

loans.name: Mejor Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mejor Futuro está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Liliam quien se dedica a la venta de perecederos negocio que inicio hace 3 años. El crédito lo invertirá en papa, cebolla, yuca y chayote.
Ella está casada y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. Con las ganancias del crédito anterior realizo un anexo en su casa.
Las otras integrantes son Solanyi quien tiene una pulpería y Miguel quien vende leña y perecederos.
texts.en:
The group el Mejor Futuro is comprised of three hard-working people.

 Liliam is one of these people who sells perishable goods-- a business she started 3 years ago. She will invest her loan in potatoes, onions, yuca and chayote. She is married and has 2 children, ages 3 and 12. With the earnings stemming from her previous loan, she was able to build an addition to her home. 

The other group members are Solanyi, who owns a small grocery store and Miguel, who sells firewood and perishable goods.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Laura Azucena

texts.es: En Playas es donde vive Laura y se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Ella esta casada y su esposo es maestro albañil su hijo tiene 17 años y está en el colegio. Laura desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de pollos empezando con una cantidad muy pequeña para su consumo, al poco tiempo varios vecinos y familiares le preguntaron si tenía para la venta por la que empezó a considerarlo un opción. Desde ese entonces realiza la crianza teniendo ahora varios galpones con diferentes tamaños. El trabajo lo realiza sola y vende de 2 a 3 días a la semana dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga. Laura admite que criar estos animalitos en cantidades grandes es de mucho cuidado ya que se le mueren por varias razones siendo muy delicados. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar pollos y cerdos para la crianza también balanceado y vitaminas. Espera a futuro poder tener un negocio más grande donde criar otros animales, en la familiar pide a Dios que le de salud para seguir con su esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Laura lives in Playas, where she raises and sells chickens for a living. She is married and has a 17 year old son that goes to shool, while her husband is a construction manager. 

Laura decided a year ago to start selling chickens after she originally started raising them for her personal consumption. Soon her relatives and neighbors asked if she she had any to sell, which ultimately led her to consider this as an option. Since then, she has been raising chickens of different sizes in several sheds. She does all the work on her own and sells chickens 2 or 3 days a week depending on how many orders she has. Laura admits that raising large quantities of these little animals entails a lot of care given that many die for various reasons because they are so delicate. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy chickens and pigs that she wants to raise, as well as vitamins and animal feed. She hopes that, in the future, she can have a bigger business to raise other animals. With regard to her family, she asks that God give her good health to keep her alongside her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Ms. Samar is a married lady who has six children. She is an active participant in her husband’s business. 

Both husband and wife are running a factory where they make yarn. They buy scrap from cotton factories and make thread after working on it. They make packets of these thread rolls and sell them to textile industries. 

Ms. Samar has applied for a loan amount of Rs. 25,000, which will be helpful for them in purchasing the required raw material and making payments.

No doubt, such ladies as Ms. Samar give society a new dimension to move step-by-step with males.

loans.use: to purchase raw material, e.g., rejected raw cotton, from factories.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina aprendió el negocio de los salones de belleza cuando trabajó en diferentes salones durante un largo tiempo; de esta manera podía sostener a sus 3 hijos que ahora tienen 12, 15 y 18 años de edad. La principal dificultad que tiene en su hogar es que es madre soltera cabeza de familia por lo que le toca generar todos los ingresos para su hogar y no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie, y si a esto se le suma que sus hijos se encuentran en una edad de estudio, sus gastos se aumentan considerablemente. Con mucho esfuerzo un día decidió abrir su propio salón de belleza y así comenzó con su propio negocio para generar mayores ingresos en su hogar. Desde entonces ha logrado que la calidad de vida en su hogar mejore y también puedan gozar de una mejor estabilidad económica, pero debido a que todavía tiene muchas dificultades para superar, Luz Marina requiere de un préstamo para comprar artículos para el salón de belleza como tinturas, tratamientos, shampoo que se han ido agotando.

De esta manera podrá seguir saliendo adelante en su salón de belleza y sus hijos podrán tener una buena calidad de vida en el hogar. Su sueño es tener un negocio muy grande donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y con el cual tenga la oportunidad de brindarles a sus hijos el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Luz Marina learned the beauty salon business when she worked at different salons over a long period of time. In this way she was able to support her three children who are now 12, 15, and 18 years old. The main difficulty she has at home is that she's a single mother and the head of the household, due to which she has to generate all the household income, not having anyone's support. This comes on top of the fact that her children are at a school age and her expenses increase considerably. With much effort one day she decided to open her own beauty salon and thus began her own business in order to generate a greater income for her household. Since then she has succeeded in improving her household's quality of life and also in them being able to enjoy better financial stability. But, due to her still having many difficulties to overcome, Luz Marina needs a loan to buy beauty salon items like dye, treatments, and shampoo that have run out.

In this way she will be abe to continue moving forward with her beauty salon and her children will be able to have a better quality of life at home. Her dream is to have a very big business where she can generate work for the most needy people and with which she has the opportunity to give her children access to a university education.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon items like dye, treatments, and shampoo that have run out.

loans.name: Avancemos Seguros  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince dias los 2 socios y las 11 socias del Banco Comunal Avancemos Seguros. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas.
 
Aquí conocimos al Señor Ángel, tiene 21 años  de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual aun no tiene hijos. Su mujer es ama de casa. El forma parte de este grupo que esperan sacar sus negocios adelante con la ayuda de los créditos que les brinda la institución, ellos son personas muy humildes pero trabajadoras que con su esfuerzo esperan sacar adelante a sus familias.

Nuestra amigo  trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz hace más de 5 años, años en los cuales ha aprendido la profesión la misma que espera en un futuro poder tener su propio taller y con esto forjarse un mejor futuro para él y su familia. Con este crédito el quiere comenzar a compra ciertas herramientas que necesita para así  poco a poco  tener lo necesario para poner su propio taller. El también en sus ratos y días libres realiza trabajos por su cuenta con lo cual se gana un dinero extra por lo cual también necesita de urgencia sus propias herramientas.

Este crédito es para comprar llaves y herramientas necesarias para su trabajo. Este es su primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Sus sueños son tener su propio taller y su casa  ya que aun vive en casa de sus padres.

La foto pequeña es de un socio que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The thirteen members of the Avancemos Seguros Community Bank meet every two weeks in the parish of San Pablo in the town of Portoviejo. They are involved in a variety of enterprises such as commerce, services etc.

One of the members is 21-year old Señor Ángel who lives with his partner. They don't yet have any children; she is a housewife. Ángel and the rest of the group hope to advance their businesses with the help of loans from the institution. They are simple but hardworking people who hope to get on in life.

Ángel has worked as an automotive mechanic for over five years. In this time he learned the trade. He hopes to run his own repair shop one day and make a better future for himself and his family. With this loan he wishes to buy certain tools and in this way gradually gather what he needs to set up his own business. In his spare time he takes on private work to earn extra money so he needs to buy tools of his own urgently.

He will use the loan to buy wrenches and other tools needed for his work. This is his first loan within the Community Bank. He enjoys being part of it because of the simplicity of the loan system.

Ángel's dream is to have a repair shop and a home of his own. He still lives with his parents.

The small photo is of a member who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy wrenches and other tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and compost for coffee production.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru:
Башорат проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ей 54 года. Она замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Муж Башорат находится на заработках за рубежом. 
Башорат занимается животноводством. Она закупает скот, разводит, и через несколько месяцев продает. Этим видом деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Bashorat lives in the city in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She's a fifty-four-year-old married mother of one child. Her husbands works abroad while Bashorat manages an animal breeding business at home. She buys cattle, breeds it, and then sells it after some months. She's run this business for the last six years.

Bashorat is asking for a loan in order to purchase some large-horned cattle.

loans.use: to purchase some bulls and calves.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. Dolores has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for six years. The profits earned from her business allows her to pay her family's monthly electric bill and to provide for their daily needs. 

Dolores wants to strengthen her business but has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. In the future, Dolores aims to have a large store to earn a higher revenue.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs

loans.name: Edwardo

texts.en:
Edwardo is a farmer. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. To make a living, Edwardo patiently raise crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He usually yields about PHP 10,000 each harvest season (twice each a year) and spends it on expenses. He would like to increase his income, which is why he is asking for a loan to invest in making his crops fruitful. He is asking for PHP 10,000 to pay for farming labor fees and buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Edwardo hopes to become a progressive farmer and lift his family from their poor living condition.

loans.use: To pay for farming labor fees and buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora María de los Ángeles es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es propietaria de un taller de calzado negocio que inicio hace 10 años y  en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de charolina, azulón, forro, brazil, fibra…etc.
texts.en: María de los Ángeles is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a shoe store that she started ten years ago. She plans to use the money from the loan to purchase patent leather, dark blue fabric, linings, brasil, and fiber, etc.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make women's shoes

loans.name: Edith Angelica

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, los tres mayorcitos ya estudian en escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga como buena esposa que es y con la finalidad de colaborar con algo realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en sus faenas en el campo, él va a  sembrar dos hectáreas de maracuyá, es para esto que ella solicito el crédito para que él lo utilice en el pago de mano de obra, como también en semillas e insecticidas para que en poco tiempo contar con una buena cosecha de esta deliciosa fruta.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, insecticidas y para pagar mano de obra en la siembra. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para ellos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of Communal Bank Patito Donald ("Little Donald Duck") meet every fifteen days in the county of Rocafuerte. The area is known for the delicious candies made by the much-renowned locals, and for the warmth of its friendly, hardworking people. 

Edith lives here. She is thirty-one years old and maintains a common-law marriage from which she has four children aged eight, six, four, and two years old. The three oldest children are already in school. Her husband makes his living through agriculture.

Like the good spouse she is, and with the goal of collaborating with her husband, Edith requests this loan for her husband's use in his work on the farm. He is going to plant two hectares of passion fruit, and it is specifically for this that she requests the loan, since they will need to pay the labor force as well as purchase seeds and inseciticides so that in a short time they can count on a good crop of this delicious fruit.

This loan will be used to buy seeds and insecticides and to pay labor for the planting. She has been through two loan cycles with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her family,

Her dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy seeds and insecticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and has been involved in rice farming for over 20 years now. She and her spouse plant and harvest rice to sell. They have two children and their income goes towards all their expenses. 

Zenaida still aims for improving her business, so she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds to grow, and to pay labor expenses in farming. With this additional capital, she will be able to have enough sustenance in her farming business. 

Zenaida hopes for fruitful crops every harvest season in order to make her income stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds to grow. and to pay labor expenses in farming

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa lives at Manalo with her spouse and four children. To surpass daily expenses of the family, her spouse operates a motorcycle and render transport service for the people in their village, while she is raising hogs to fatten, breed and, sell to butchers upon maturity. While they are engaged in these kinds of businesses, the couple also cultivates a hectare rice field on which they plant and harvest rice to sell. 

Now, Luisa would like to strengthen the farming business and make it more productive, but she has insufficient funds. This is why she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy insecticides and pesticides to use in farming. This will help nourish the crops and become healthier. 

Someday, with good profits from all their businesses, she will continuously pay the school fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides to use in farming

loans.name: Florinda Juana

texts.es:
La señora Florinda Juana, tiene 60  años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos que lo apoyan económicamente, ya que ella es viuda, se dedica a la elaboración de delantales típicos para diferentes edades, inicio este trabaja gracias al apoyo de un familiar, y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia, solo así ha mantenido y sustentado a su familia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas típicas de varios diseños y colores, como también hilos y adorno para poder producir mas delantales, y tener mas ganancias, espera en el futuro poder dejar el negocio a uno de sus hijas para que continúe realizando este trabajo, que para ella ha sido de mucho beneficio.
texts.en:
Florinda Juana is 60 years old. She didn't have the chance to go to school. She has 4 children who support her financially, since she is a widow. She makes tradional aprons for different ages. She started this job thanks to support from her family and has 25 years experience. This is the only way she has supported herself and her family. 

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy traditional fabrics with different designs and colors. She will also buy threads and notions to produce more aprons and have more earnings. She hopes that in the future she can leave her business to one of her daughters she she can continue to do this work that has been so beneficial for her.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics for aprons.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lucrecia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad, solo uno  de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga con la ayuda de su esposo y también con la de uno de los créditos hace tres años atrás construyo un pequeño galpón para criar pollos de granja, empezó con poco y hoy mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada, nos cuenta que estos los compra desde pequeños y los mantiene por dos a tres meses, tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen desarrollo para luego venderlos ya sea por libras o en pie a personas de su localidad o a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos y alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un  buen desarrollo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la unión que hay en el grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The members of Communal Bank Patito Donald ("Little Donald Duck") meet every fifteen days in the county of Rocafuerte. The area is known for the delicious candies made by the much-renowned locals, and for the warmth of its friendly, hardworking people. 

Lucrecia lives here. She is sixty years old and married and has six children from this relationship. All are grown, and only one of them still lives with her. Her husband makes his living in agriculture.

Our friend, with the help of her husband and a loan from three years ago, constructed a small shed for raising chickens. She started with little and today puts up as many as two hundred chickens each season. She tells us that she buys them when they are small and keeps them for two to three months, time enough for them to have good growth so that she can sell them later at fairs or on foot to people in the area or to merchants who come to the house.

This loan is to buy chickens and feed and medicines so that they can have a good development. She has been with the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it for the sense of cooperation that exists among the group.
 
Her dream is to have good health for herself and her own.

loans.use: to buy chickens as well as feed and medicines for the same.

loans.name: Sandra Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sandra, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 13 y 7 años de edad, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con su labor realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en sus faenas en el campo, ellos tienen sembríos de arroz, verduras y yuca, nos cuenta que en la actualidad están por recoger la cosecha de arroz la misma que gracias a Dios ha sido muy buena ya que la anterior  se les perdió con el invierno, se les perdió más de una hectárea de sus cultivos pero gracias al crédito anterior pudo volver a sembrar y es esta la cosecha que por suerte está muy buena y les va a permitir recuperara parte de lo perdido.

Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra en la recolección del arroz. Lleva cuatro años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos han salido de situaciones muy difíciles.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of Communal Bank Patito Donald ("Little Donald Duck") meet every fifteen days in the county of Rocafuerte. The area is known for the delicious candies made by the much-renowned locals, and for the warmth of its friendly, hardworking people. 

Sandra lives here. She is thirty-five years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children ages seventeen, thirteen, and seven years old. The two older children are in high school and the youngest in elementary school. Her husband makes his living in agriculture.

Our friend, with the goal of helping her husband in his work, requests this loan for his use in work on the farm. They have fields of rice, vegetables, and yucca. She tells us that they are currently harvesting a crop of rice that thanks to God has been very good, since they lost the previous one due to bad winter weather. They lost more than a hectare of crops, but thanks to their previous loan, they were able to return to planting and since this crop is luckily very good, they will be able to recuperate part of what they lost.

This loan will be used to pay the labor from the rice harvest. Sandra has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, they have survived very difficult situations.
 
Her dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Wajida's Group

texts.en:
Wajida is 47 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. She requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to expand the trading business that she has been doing for five years.

She wants the loan to buy products for daily consumption like bread, milk, eggs, beans, matches, vegetables, fruits and natural drinks, among others. 

She believes in hard work and honesty and is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like bread, milk, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Eduardo es casado, tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, pantalones, playeras, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio inició este negocio siendo trabajador para otro negocio, y lleva 10 años de experiencia con este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo va a comprar más tela e hilos, espera que en el futuro mejore en ganancias  y mejore su condición de vida, quiere tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Edgar Eduardo is forty years old and married. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He has three children who are in school. He makes his living producing textiles such as pants and T-shirts. He counts on the support of his wife who makes her living in the same business. He started this business as a worker for a different company. He has ten years experience with the work.
